trustfund:
TF037678-COLOMBIA - DECENTRALIZED ED MGT,TF032308-COLOMBIA - MUNICIPAL HEALTH PROJECT,TF020400-NETHERLANDS' CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, though institutional
            development impacts are only modest. Lessons reinforce once
            again, the beneficial aspects of flexible projects, which as
            in this case, the continuous evolution in the interpretation
            of project objectives, permitted adaptation to radical
            changes in the policy context. Particularly in this project,
            such flexibility became an important tool for the
            project's survival in a changing political, and
            economic environment, whose highly focused monitoring, and
            evaluation criteria, adapted to the overall project
            indicators, allowing an essential, and rigorous
            post-evaluation. Moreover, the reconciliatory effect that
            projects supporting health, and social sectors can have in
            countries suffering from difficult security problems, was
            demonstrated by this project's state presence at the
            local level, responsive to people's needs, especially
            in areas with precarious security.
